result.execSummary:
The defendant Adolfo Heredia-Flores was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Bond on file applied to costs.
Maintain employment.  Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Credit for 1 day served if probation is revoked.

records.addlTxt: DV court.  Court reviewed his petition for discharge.  Discharged from DV court.
DV court.  He worked on his discharge paperwork.  Get to T.M.  Drop off today.  Can present at next DV court date.
DV court.  Agent got information from Stein.  Contact Stein to set up appointment in January yet.  Find out how much it costs.  Talk to agent.  Agent wants to talk to the children also.

DV Court.  T.M. has a list of the children's activities.  OK with agent.  Agent will try to talk to the children.  Agent hasn't heard back from the mother yet.  Get information from the agent.  Final project next week with B.G.

DV court.  Children's schedule sent to T.M.  He hasn't received a copy yet.  Referred to Stein Counseling.  Has an appointment.  Expensive.  B.G. will discuss with Human Services.  He should talk to T.M. also.
DV Court - BG's class is going well.  Discussed family issue.  He is to get schedule and talk to TM.
DV Court - He reports things are going pretty good.  Work is busy.  Making his appointments.
Recorded by FTR.  DV court.  Things going good.  Explained what he is learning.  Discussion on the last visit with his children.  He understands how he can arrange to see his children.  h
DV court.  Went to farm, family time.  Discussion on family.  Good job.

Feels he's doing well.  Discussed relationship issues.  May want to re-do empathy letter.

Agent reiterates what he needs to do before contact.
DV court.  Things going good.  Living arrangements good.  Working 12-13 hours per day.  Discussion on relationship and where he is going with it.
DV Court.  Living situation good.  Working on retaining an attorney.  He is happier now.  BG's class going good also.
DV court.  Discussion on living situation.  Discussion on marital situation.  Things going good with B.G.'s class.
DV Court - Current living situation is better and going well.  Discussed family issues.  Reminded him of no contact.  He should discuss with TM.
DV court.  In custody.  Causing family anguish.  Will start over B.G's class.  No contacts reminded.  After release, contact agent.
DV court.  He uses what he learns from B.G's class at home.
DV Court.  Having problems.  Options discussed.
DV court.  Having difficulty in class with spanish/english work in B.G's class.  Ask for help.  Agent can help also.

DV Court - discussed job issue concerning DV Court commitment.  He is to talk to the attorney that represented him if he's considering self-revoking.  He has gone to 2 classes.  Also Court instructs him to talk to T.M.
DV Court - Defendant's first time to DV Court.  Agent Miles instructed him to attend today to observe.
DNA submission form

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Betthauser.  Plead guilty to Count 1.  DC, domestic.  1 year probation.  Victim notification complied with.  Victim present.  No restitution request.  No statement.  No interpreter needed.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he is pleading to.  Defendant understood.  Defendant plead guilty.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Possibililty of deportation advised to the defendant.   Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Count 1.  Count 2 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA, and rec. treatment.  DV programming if agent recommends.  Obtain and maintain employment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Court ordered;  sentence withheld, 1 year probation.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA, and recommended treatment.  DV programming if agent recommends.  Maintain employment.  Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.     The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC, DNA sample and surcharge.  Domestic abuse surcharge.  Credit for 1 day.  Apply bond to CC.
